body:
### Problem

- Crash sometimes happens when closing a fugitive `:G` status window.
- Has been an issue for ~1 year, not related to recent changes.

```
Thread 0 Crashed::  Dispatch queue: com.apple.main-thread
0   libsystem_kernel.dylib        	    0x7ff81cdf100e __pthread_kill + 10
1   libsystem_pthread.dylib       	    0x7ff81ce271ff pthread_kill + 263

4   nvim                          	       0x10eb8eb24 ui_comp_raw_line + 692

70  nvim                          	       0x10e9598fd execute_cmd0 + 221
71  nvim                          	       0x10e954470 do_one_cmd + 9056
72  nvim                          	       0x10e9510f1 do_cmdline + 4001
73  nvim                          	       0x10eb9bc9b do_ucmd + 3307
74  nvim                          	       0x10e959997 execute_cmd0 + 375
75  nvim                          	       0x10e954470 do_one_cmd + 9056
76  nvim                          	       0x10e9510f1 do_cmdline + 4001
77  nvim                          	       0x10ea4104d nv_colon + 669
78  nvim                          	       0x10ea3d0fd normal_execute + 9373
79  nvim                          	       0x10eb45ad9 state_enter + 121
80  nvim                          	       0x10e81104b main + 17675
81  dyld                          	       0x10f8a652e start + 462
``` 

### Steps to reproduce

1. have some windows open
2. have `:G` status window open from https://github.com/tpope/vim-fugitive
3. `ZQ` to close the window the fugitive status window

I don't have more precise steps because the crash is inconsistent.

Always happens with `ZQ` on the fugitive status window, never other windows. Possibly an autocmd? Though looks related to `msgmore` trying to show something...

### Expected behavior

no crash

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.0-dev-1216+g 673d2b52fa43

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

macos

### Terminal name/version

Terminal.app

### $TERM environment variable

screen-256color

### Installation

source

comment_data.body: Does this happen only with 'lazyredraw' set?

Is this Release mode? given the lack of debug info, I assume NDEBUG is set, and thus it is this assert 

>  assert(endcol <= clearcol);

`RelWithDebInfo` , build command: 

    make CMAKE_EXTRA_FLAGS="-DLANGUAGES=en_GB" CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo && sudo make install

> Does this happen only with 'lazyredraw' set?

good question, I'll remove that and report back.

happened without 'lazyredraw'. stacktrace is a bit different:

```
Thread 0 Crashed::  Dispatch queue: com.apple.main-thread
0   libsystem_kernel.dylib        	    0x7ff81cdf100e __pthread_kill + 10
1   libsystem_pthread.dylib       	    0x7ff81ce271ff pthread_kill + 263
2   libsystem_c.dylib             	    0x7ff81cd72d24 abort + 123
3   libsystem_c.dylib             	    0x7ff81cd720cb __assert_rtn + 314
4   nvim                          	       0x104985bf4 ui_comp_raw_line + 692
5   nvim                          	       0x1049816f1 ui_line + 161
6   nvim                          	       0x104818ebd msg_scroll_flush + 477
7   nvim                          	       0x104981a97 ui_flush + 359
8   nvim                          	       0x10479245b inchar + 75
9   nvim                          	       0x104797e1a vgetorpeek + 7690
10  nvim                          	       0x104795bb3 vgetc + 1155
11  nvim                          	       0x104813bce wait_return + 862
12  nvim                          	       0x10474b5a2 do_cmdline + 7394
13  nvim                          	       0x10483a5ed nv_colon + 669
14  nvim                          	       0x10483669d normal_execute + 9373
15  nvim                          	       0x10493cad9 state_enter + 121
16  nvim                          	       0x1046084cb main + 17675
17  dyld                          	       0x10ad7d52e start + 462
```

I've been seeing this recently, ~suspect it's the same assertion getting hit too - [`endcol <= clearcol`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/bab4bcdefbdad7f175f7f31c230de3d066963542/src/nvim/ui_compositor.c#L514-L514)~.

In fact I tell a lie - it's the [`attrs[i] >= 0` assertion](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/bab4bcdefbdad7f175f7f31c230de3d066963542/src/nvim/ui_compositor.c#L544) that's hit.

And likewise, triggered by a plain `:G`.

~Does seem to happen randomly though - I can have a debugger watch for the next one if needed.~
Update: I've got a reasonable reliable way of reproducing it, will attempt to get a debug build and bisect (it seems opening nvim, doing `:G`, then `:G amend --no-e` (or some other git alias) triggers it).


```
* thread #1, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = breakpoint 4.2
  * frame #0: 0x00007ff817ac9c2a libsystem_c.dylib`abort
    frame #1: 0x00007ff817ac8fbe libsystem_c.dylib`__assert_rtn + 314
    frame #2: 0x0000000106c59c69 nvim`ui_comp_raw_line + 969
    frame #3: 0x0000000106c55b51 nvim`ui_line + 161
    frame #4: 0x0000000106b0614d nvim`msg_scroll_flush + 477
    frame #5: 0x0000000106c56126 nvim`ui_flush + 774
    frame #6: 0x0000000106a82721 nvim`inchar + 81
    frame #7: 0x0000000106a87c76 nvim`vgetorpeek.llvm.11295987581389418917 + 5862
    frame #8: 0x0000000106a85fcf nvim`vgetc + 1167
    frame #9: 0x0000000106b0198f nvim`wait_return + 719
    frame #10: 0x0000000106a41976 nvim`do_cmdline + 13862
    frame #11: 0x0000000106b25fb6 nvim`nv_colon.llvm.2359390459227526119 + 614
    frame #12: 0x0000000106b21fb6 nvim`normal_execute.llvm.2359390459227526119 + 9654
    frame #13: 0x0000000106c0f492 nvim`state_enter + 114
    frame #14: 0x000000010690617a nvim`main + 16666
    frame #15: 0x00007ff81784d310 dyld`start + 2432
```

Additional details: this might be incorrect, but it seems to be only when `:G` is open, and I'm also running a `:G` command (or some variant, e.g. `:G diff` etc)

I have a feeling this might be to do with [display/grid throttling](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/907018e547c9b989781667d2cf951e1abf99ab9d/src/nvim/message.c#L2407-L2407) - all the times I've had nvim crash have been when `G`'s outputting a fair bit of text to the screen (for example `:G fetch`, or `G rebase`).

Could it hurt to comment out that `if (msg_grid.throttled)` to increase the likelyhood of the crash, and see what happens? Or have I got the wrong end of the stick behind `.throttled` ?

labels.description: We need minimal steps to reproduce the issue
labels.name: needs:repro

labels.name: bug-crash
